alert.note: Alert for Southwest Wyoming (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 07 at 2:51PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Rich and northwestern Uinta Counties through 315 PM MDT... At 250 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Woodruff, or 8 miles south of Randolph, moving northeast at 5 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Randolph and Woodruff. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
